paper_abstract: Discontinuous constituents. and free word order pose constant problems in natural language parsing. String generating hypergraph grammars have been proven useful for handling discontinuous constituents. In this paper we describe a new notation for hypergraph productions that allows on-the-fly interconnection of graph parts with regard to user-defined constraints. These constraints handle the order of nodes within the string hypergraph. The HyperEarley parser for string generating hypergraph grammars [1] is adapted to the new formalism. A German example is used for the explanation of the new notation and algorithms.
paper_title: String generating hypergraph grammars with word order restrictions
